title: [Effect of "consulting rooms" on the effectiveness of the treatment of patients with newly diagnosed pulmonary tuberculosis].
abstract: It was established that, with the beginning of the functioning of the 'Consulting cabinets" the proportion of patients with newly diagnosed pulmonary tuberculosis (NDPT) who were discharged from the clinic with the result of interrupted treatment reduced twice, the index of discharge of patients with NDPT with bacterioexcretion in the intensive phase of treatment up to two months of treatment declined by 8,7 times, the proportion of patients with NDPT sent for outpatient treatment out of the number of patients who discontinued the treatment on the in patient phase increased by 2,1 times, the proportion of patients with NDPT who discontinued treatment in the Zaporozhye region decreased by 1,6 times and the proportion of patients with NDPT the Zaporozhye region who discontinued treatment and received psychosocial care reduced 5,4 times.
